text_overlay_intent: The text demands a high-prestige cinematic blockbuster atmosphere that prioritizes professional dominance, technical mastery, and the 'Hero' archetype found in elite-tier sports and military operations.
dominant_narrative: The symbiotic relationship between an elite operator and their high-performance machine, where technical precision meets raw, visceral speed.

Intro.reasoning: The intro must establish the 'weight' of the protagonist and the tools of their trade. Using INTENSITY through close-ups of gear and quiet, focused environments builds the necessary tension before the kinetic release.

Build-up.reasoning: This stage functions as the 'pre-flight' sequence. It requires a rhythmic escalation of technical preparation—adjusting visors, engine ignitions, and slow-moving machinery—to signal that the transition to ACTION is imminent.

Peak.intent_diluting_material: Slow-motion reflections, indoor shots, dialogue-heavy moments
Peak.reasoning: The peak must be relentless. It should favor high-velocity movement and aggressive maneuvers. The machine (jet/vehicle) becomes the primary actor, but intercutting the pilot's focused gaze maintains the human stakes.

Outro.intent_diluting_material: Fast cuts, loud mechanical noise, aggressive motion
Outro.reasoning: The release requires a return to the human element. A single, evocative shot of reflection or a vast, quiet landscape provides the 'afterburn' effect, allowing the audience to process the preceding intensity.

strengths: Abundant high-energy aviation footage that mirrors the 'F1' speed requirement.
Strong 'Hero' imagery of pilots that aligns with the driver-focused intent.
High-quality cinematic textures (grain, lens flares, golden hour) matching the reference style.
editorial_tradeoffs: Aviation assets must serve as a narrative proxy for automotive racing to maintain the 'F1' text intent.
Limited 'Medium' energy clips require careful pacing in the build-up to avoid a premature jump to peak energy.
constraint_gaps: Lack of actual Formula 1 vehicles; the edit must rely on the 'feeling' of speed and technical precision rather than literal subject matter.
Scarce indoor/technical display shots may limit the 'technical precision' aspect of the reference.

editorial_strategy: The edit will treat the fighter jets as the spiritual equivalent of F1 cars, focusing on the 'Operator vs. Machine' narrative. By anchoring the high-speed action with intense human close-ups, the system will replicate the 'F1 The Movie' trailer's emotional arc—moving from the quiet focus of the garage (hangar) to the violent speed of the track (sky).
remake_strategy: To achieve a true Director's Cut, integrate macro-photography of mechanical components (pistons, telemetry screens) and high-frame-rate shots of driver/pilot perspiration to heighten the physical toll of the speed.

editorial_motifs.trigger: Pilot visor adjustment or eye contact
Transition from cockpit to vast landscape
